I do not remember we discussed this.
single space definitely make it harder to read it as code(in html it is not a problem as extra formatting is applied).
I am not ready to discuss what is best separator length, we will get it empirically eventually. Ones new Check appear on this we will decide on convention.

That was BAD example, completely hard to read by humans, single space separator is BAD or there should be some rules on how description is starting.
But we will come back to this a bit later, special Check is required to be created for this.

nodes.bodyText:
please remove "final" modifiers, we use check to control it.
usage of it make code too verbose, as ALL parameters must be non modifiable, it is too much verbosity for code.
This Check lacking our attention for many year as it waiting for complete rewriting to use javadoc ast.

nodes.bodyText:
please move this commit to functional
at build on it result in
JavadocTypeCheckTest.testAllowMissingTypeParameters:314->AbstractModuleTestSupport.verify:229->AbstractModuleTestSupport.verify:267->AbstractModuleTestSupport.verify:304 error message 1 expected:<...sed @param tag for '[x]'.> but was:<...sed @param tag for '[<x>]'.>
All commits are atomic change that are build-able and even can be released. code should be build and function properly on each commit.
Done.  I had forgotten about that, apologies.
